title: Designing Blended Learning Environments in Business Administration: Flipped Learning-Based Organizational Behavior and Strategic Management Strategies (Emphasizing Civic Leadership and Sustainable Management)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational business administration theories (organizational behavior, marketing, financial management) and basic educational design principles, collaborative competencies as a citizen. Additionally, familiarity with basic concepts of business environment analysis, resource-based view, organizational culture innovation, sustainable management, and global economic contexts
context.additional_context: A practical instructional design competency enhancement course for pre-service/in-service teachers. Focuses on integrating core business administration concepts (business environment analysis, resource-based view) into educational design. Particularly reflects organizational adaptation strategies and sustainable management strategies in global economic environments within educational design, emphasizing civic leadership and organizational culture innovation

learning_goals: Propose three or more design frameworks for applying flipped learning-based blended models to business administration education (organizational behavior, strategic management, etc.), incorporating citizen leadership development strategies and organizational culture innovation plans reflecting corporate environment analysis and resource-based perspectives.

During the 3-week intermediate course, learners apply four of five decision-making process stages through offline role-playing (2 sessions) and discussions (3 sessions) based on online pre-learning materials (3 business case analyses). They can propose stakeholder relationship management and organizational culture innovation strategies meeting at least three of five leadership development rubric items, considering organizational adaptation strategies in global economic environments.

Design two or more interactive activities (group discussions, case studies) to engage learners through formative assessments (feedback surveys, peer evaluations). Assessments consider organizational collaboration competencies, civic consciousness cultivation, and sustainable management strategy development capabilities.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
